alert.note: Alert for Boone; Clay; Clinton; Hendricks; Monroe; Montgomery; Morgan; Owen; Parke; Putnam (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 29 at 2:59PM EDT until June 29 at 3:45PM EDT by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: The National Weather Service in Indianapolis has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northern Monroe County in south central Indiana... Southwestern Clinton County in central Indiana... Morgan County in central Indiana... Hendricks County in central Indiana... Central Clay County in west central Indiana... Owen County in west central Indiana... Southeastern Parke County in west central Indiana... Boone County in central Indiana... Montgomery County in west central Indiana... Putnam County in west central Indiana... * Until 345 PM EDT. * At 259 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 9 miles northeast of Veedersburg to 7 miles south of Terre Haute, moving east at 80 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect considerable tree damage. Damage is likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. * Severe thunderstorms will be near... New Richmond around 305 PM EDT. Linden and Center Point around 310 PM EDT. Darlington, Colfax, Bowling Green and Patricksburg around 315 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of these severe thunderstorms include Thorntown, Cagles Mill Lake, Spencer, Gosport, Devore, Quincy, McCormicks Creek State Park, Paragon, Stinesville and Martinsville. This includes the following highways... Interstate 65 between mile markers 128 and 147. Interstate 70 between mile markers 21 and 68. Interstate 74 between mile markers 28 and 69. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.

area.areaDesc: Boone; Clay; Clinton; Hendricks; Monroe; Montgomery; Morgan; Owen; Parke; Putnam
